results.title: The Monkey's mask
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, John Maynard, Robert Connolly, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Arenafilm
results.brief_description: Dorothy Porter’s prose novel, “The Monkey’s Mask” was a tantalizing blend of the noir aesthetic, nocturnal sexual desire and the back stabbing Sydney literary scene. Given that, director Samantha Lang’s task to translate it into a coherent cinematic whole proves a challenging task. Susie Porter stars as Sapphic private detective Jill Fitzpatrick, who is called in to investigate the mysterious disappearance of literature student and grunge poet, Mickey Norris (Abbie Cornish). Jill’s investigation leads her to Mickey’s lecturer, the sensuous Diana (Kelly McGillis), who although married and a potential suspect, Mickey begins a passionate affair with. Lang and her cast have plenty of fun with the unlikely coupling of the gritty film noir genre and the cliquey Sydney poetry scene, mixing the two at times to witty effect. Lang and screenwriter Anne Kennedy also play with the literary form by dividing the film into chapter headings and having the characters recite some of Dorothy Porter’s elegant prose. Cast includes Deborah Mailman, Marton Csokas, William Zappa, Chris Haywood and Annie Jones.

results.title: The Most fertile man in Ireland
results.creator_credit: Dudi Appleton, David Collins, Alibi Films and Sky Pictures
results.brief_description: Eamon is a nerdish love-lorn 24-year-old virgin who lives with his mother and works for a dating agency. In love with a local girl who works in a funeral parlour, Eamon is depressed about his prospects of getting a date with her, given his dowdy physical appearance and bumbling nature. One night Eamon is picked up in a bar, and despite protection makes the girl pregnant. This leads to the discovery that Eamon has an unnaturally high sperm count which makes him an ideal donor for childless couples. Eamon’s talent is soon turned into a thriving small business as he reaps in money from impregnating women all over Ireland, with the sanction of the Catholic Church. When Eamon manages to get lucky with the girl of his dreams, their future together is threatened by his past. The debut of director Dudi Applteon, “The Most fertile men in Ireland” is a mostly harmless comedy about love, sex, honour, parenthood and sperm. Cast includes: Kris Marshall, James Nesbitt, Bronagh Gallagher and Kathy Keira Clarke.

results.title: Love's a bitch = Amores perros [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu, Zeta Film (Mexico) and Altavista Films
results.brief_description: Perhaps the only successful commercial Mexican release in contemporary cinema, “Amores perros” is action-packed and hard-hitting from the first frame. Divided into three separate but overlapping narratives (a la Altman and Tarantino), each explores themes of loss, survival, despair and the constant battle of life and change. The three strands are linked by a horrendous car accident that also symbolises the frenetic and explosive nature of life in this urban jungle. The first story focuses on the young Octavio (played by Gael Garcia Bernal), who is also entangled in the local dog-fighting scene, his infatuation with his sister-in-law, a young mother juggling school and an adulterous, criminal husband. The second centres on supermodel, Valeria (Goya Toldeo), whose life is turned asunder when she is seriously hurt and the strain this places on her relationship with a man who has just left his wife and children for her. Finally, the last and most poetic narrative strand centres on a former political fighter now a homeless, contracted hitman who longs for his family. Hand-held camerawork, fast editing and music inserts work hard to keep the drama intense and frenetic. Thematically, “Amores perros” explores the idea of life as an endless struggle where humans are like ‘animals’ in their sheer attempt to survive. In fact, both ‘dog’ and ‘human’ undergo mutilation and abandonment throughout the film and are pushed to the extreme in their ability to endure a world of hard-knocks. Mexican cinema and television has a long history of melodrama and ‘Amores perros’ clearly emerges from this tradition, infusing strong doses of story melodrama with modern storytelling and edgy stylistics. If its ‘life lessons’ are at times cliched and heavy-handed, the film is still an engaging, commanding experience. In Spanish with English subtitles. Note: Contains violence against animals and human mutilation and carnage.

results.title: The Fifth element [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Patrick Ledoux, Columbia and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The Fifth Element takes an amazing glimpse into the future, with wonderful visual effects from the people who gave us “Titanic”, “Nikita” and “The Professional”, and unique costumes by visionary designer, Jean-Paul Gaultier. If the four elements are fire, water, earth and air, what is the Fifth element? What does it do? Who has control of it? These questions and others are answered as the film unfolds at a breath taking pace. This film takes you on a sci-fi thrill ride of the decade. Bruce Willis, a taxi-driver in New York city in the 23rd Century is selected as our hero. He will travel to the end of the galaxy to decide the fate of our universe. Cast includes Gary Oldman, Milla Jovovich, Ian Holm and Chris Tucker.

results.title: Jeffrey
results.creator_credit: Christopher Ashley, Victoria Maxwell, Mitchell Maxwell, Mark Balsam, The Booking Office and Working Man Films
results.brief_description: This film manages to convey a serious message about the impact of “safe sex” on gay male relationships despite its surreal and comedic approach. Fed up with paranoid lovers, endless bundles of blood test results, and the consuming fear of investing emotionally in a partner he may lose to AIDS, Jeffrey decides to give up sex for good. He rationalises that this will allow him to channel his energy into his career and hobbies, which in turn will help him to forget about sex. However, his resolve is soon put to the test when he meets the gorgeous body-builder Steve (Michael T. Weiss) while working out at the gym. Torn between wanting to ravish Steve and wanting to maintain his celibacy, Jeffrey turns to his best friend Sterling (Patrick Stewart) for advice. As circumstances (and friends) conspire to bring Steve and Jeffrey together, Jeffrey begins to warm to the idea of a committed relationship. However, Steve’s revelation about his HIV-positive status soon throws a spanner in the works and Jeffrey finds himself caught between love and fear once again. Seeking the advice of Sterling and his partner Darius, a post-modern evangelist, a self-help group, his liberal parents, and a randy Catholic priest, Jeffrey struggles to come to terms with the concept that a life lived in fear is no life at all. Features a variety of cameos from stars such as Sigourney Weaver, Camryn Manheim, Olympia Dukakis, Kathy Najimy, Christine Baranski, and Nathan Lane. Based on the play by Paul Rudnick.

results.title: The Tao of Steve
results.creator_credit: Jenniphr Goodman, Anthony Bregman and Thunderhead Productions
results.brief_description: Santa Fe primary school teacher Dex (Donal Logue) is a success with the ladies and he owes it all to Steve - Steve Austin, Steve McQueen, Steve McGarrett - the prototypical cool American male, he never has to impress the women but always gets the ladies. Dex and his entourage of single male friends (one is happily married), subscribe to the tao of Steve, valuing such ideals as suppressing that which you desire and doing something excellent in front of the ladies. Dex’s comfortable, philandering existence is thrown into turmoil when he meets Syd (Greer Goodman) - a conquest from his thinner, college years - whom, to his surprise, he discovers he is falling in love with, causing him to question the code by which he has lived his life thus far. A surprise sleeper at the 2000 Sundance Film Festival, Goodman’s directorial debut saw Donal Logue awarded with a Special Jury Prize.

results.title: Legend of the seven golden vampires
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Vee King Shaw, Don Houghton, Shaw Production and Hammer
results.brief_description: Hammer Horror meets martial arts mayhem in “The Legend of the seven golden vampires,” allegedly the first kung-fu horror film co-produced entirely on location in Hong Kong. This action-packed and bloodthirsty tale of vengeance and family honour begins in nineteenth century Transylvania, where Kah, High Priest of the Seven Golden Vampires, abases himself before the mouldering tomb of Dracula, and begs him to resurrect his vampires - sleeping after a brave farmer dares to kill one of them - so that his temple in the remote village of Ping Kwei may become a site of power once again. However, Dracula, being the sinister creature he is, seizes the opportunity to do more than assist… Exactly one hundred years later, Dr. Van Helsing attempts to convince Chinese academics from Chunking University to help him locate the village to uncover the six remaining vampires. After suffering their scorn, he resolves to leave Chunking, only to be confronted by a man claiming to be the ancestor of the farmer who had killed the seventh vampire. Hsi Ching reveals that Van Helsing and his foppish son Leyland have been under the exclusive protection of his family since coming to China, and provides the Professor with proof of his connection to the vampire legend. After the wealthy and adventurous widow Vanessa Buren offers to finance the risky venture, Van Helsing agrees to lead an expedition to Ping Kwei to rid the village of its vampire curse. But the forces of evil are stronger than they anticipate, and it takes all the martial arts skill of Ching’s siblings combined with Van Helsing’s vampire-vanquishing experience to defeat the remaining vampires and legions of undead sent to stop them before it is too late. The vampires in this film are very Westernised and quite different to the more well known “hopping vampires” found in later films such as Encounters of the spooky kind (1980) and Mr. Vampire (1985). Stars Peter Cushing as Van Helsing, Chan Shen as Kah, David Chiang as Hsi Ching, Julie Ege as Vanessa Buren, and Shi Szu as Mei Kwei. In English with some subtitles.

results.title: Smokey and the bandit
results.creator_credit: Hal Needham, Mort Engelberg, Rastar Films and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: When maverick truck driver “Bandit” (Burt Reynolds) is approached by a father and son team at a Truck Rodeo, it sparks the beginning of a wild ride from Georgia to Texas. The challenge is for Bandit to drive from one state to the other, collect a truckload of Coors beer, and return with the precious load within 28 hours. The challenge has been laid before but never completed. The reward is $80,000, the danger lies in the fact that his actions qualify as bootlegging (taking beer across state lines without a permit is illegal). Bandit enlists the help of his buddy, “The Snowman” (Jerry Reed), while Bandit rides shotgun in a 1976 Black Trans Am - Bandit One. Before long a damsel in distress joins the small crew when Bandit picks up hitchhiking runaway bride Carrie (Sally Field). Carrie was supposed to be marrying Junior, and her future father-in-law, Sheriff Buford T Justice (Jackie Gleason), aka “The Bandit”, is soon in pursuit of his son’s intended. Whilst it didn’t receive much critical success, this slice of 70s nostalgia is laden with silly and sexist one liners, impressive car chase sequences, a fondness for the culture of CB radios and an anti-authoritarian stance. Having said that, it also took $126+ million at the box office.

The challenge is for Bandit to drive from one state to the other, collect a truckload of Coors beer, and return with the precious load within 28 hours. The challenge has been laid before but never completed. The reward is $80,000, the danger lies in the fact that his actions qualify as bootlegging (taking beer across state lines without a permit is illegal). Bandit enlists the help of his buddy, “The Snowman” (Jerry Reed), while Bandit rides shotgun in a 1976 Black Trans Am - Bandit One. Before long a damsel in distress joins the small crew when Bandit picks up hitchhiking runaway bride Carrie (Sally Field). Having said that, it also took $126+ million at the box office.

results.title: Dead men don't wear plaid [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Carl Reiner, David V. Picker, William McEuen, Aspen Film Society and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Steve Martin is Rigby Reardon, the best private eye of all time. Juliet Forrest (Rachel Ward) comes to his office with a case. Her father, a noted scientist, philanthropist and cheesemaker has mysteriously died. A complex trail of clues leads Reardon to “Carlotta’s lists”. Reiner has captured the essence of 1940’s detective films and presents an exciting but “fun” film. Reardon’s special “friends” include Alan Ladd, Barbara Stanwyck, Ray Milland, Burt Lancaster, Humphrey Bogart and Charles Laughton.

results.title: Mallrats
results.creator_credit: Kevin Smith, Scott Mosier, James Jacks, Laura Greenlee, Sean Daniel, View Askew Productions, Alphaville and Gramercy Pictures
results.brief_description: When T.S. (Jeremy London) arrives to pick up his girlfriend Brandi (Claire Forlani) for their planned vacation, she cancels their plans to be a contestant on her father’s game show. Hurt by Brandi’s rejection, T.S. visits her neighbour and his friend Brodie (Jason Lee), who also has just been dumped by his girlfriend Rene (Shannon Doherty). The two head to the mall in an attempt to console themselves. When they discover that Brandi’s father’s show is being recorded in the mall that very day, they enlist the help of troublemakers Jay (Jason Mewes) and Silent Bob (director Kevin Smith) to stop the show. The sequel to Kevin Smith’s hit film “Clerks”, and the second film in his ‘New Jersey’ series. Cast also includes Ben Affleck, Joey Lauren Adams, Renee Humphrey, Ethan Suplee and comic book tycoon Stan Lee.
